definitions: To move slowly and carefully, especially in order to avoid being heard or noticed.
To move with the body close to the ground; to crawl.
To grow along the ground or a surface, or up a wall, as a plant.
To have the sensation of something crawling on one's skin.
To gradually and imperceptibly become evident or more pronounced.
examples: The cat will creep up on the bird.
The baby started to creep across the floor.
Ivy tends to creep up the side of the house.
The thought of spiders makes my skin creep.
Inflation began to creep into the economy.
